main event: Several persons observed a bright white light in the western sky over Ft. Pierce, Florida from March 23 to March 30, 1961, which pulsated and oscillated before disappearing at high speed.
interesting points: The light was 3-4 times brighter than the brightest stars in the sky., Observations were made both visually and on radar., The sighting lasted between 1 minute to 1 hour., Several witnesses reported seeing the light disappear at high speed., Initial sightings suggested the object might be a jet airliner, but it was not positively identified.
sighted object: a bright white light in the western sky
witness description: Several observers including airline and military personnel reported the sighting.
